column4: what does the readme say you need as deps? This one at a time piecemeal method will get old fast
they are the library headers that allows you to compile apps that use the X server

must not have been able to handle the flood of missing people rejoining us.   X includes are the library headers that allow you to compile apps that use the X server, just as the zlib1g-dev headers allows you to compile stuff that uses compression
so, you should read the README file, probably tells you all the stuff you need to compile successfully
How do I get it? From synaptic or no?
I didn't see any of that in there.
It still says that it cant find 'x includes'.
then try xorg-dev , I tried to get you the minimum
That time is said it didn't find libjpeg or QT. So I'm installing a bunch of QT stuff.
It reads: 'checking for Qt... configure: error: Qt (>= Qt 2.2.2) (headers and libraries) not found. Please check your installation!'
was away for a sec, install libqt3-mt-dev
your issue is getting the necessary support libs for the things you want to compile. You're slowly getting the ones for this app, and you need to do the same for anything you compile
get the -dev stuff you need. No reason to clutter ubuntu systems when only a small percentage will be doing compiling
you might try gmountiso (I never really paid attention to exactly what you were compiling ;)
ls /usr/include , is one of those qt something?
